member.summary: Additional CSS classes for the accordion container.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxAccordion.ExpandedItemIds
member.summary: IDs of the expanded items (if is true, several items can be expanded). Do not use a constant value as it resets the accordion on every roundtrip. Use to set the initial state. When is true, this parameter must be used to manage expanded items, and the event callback will be invoked for changes.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxAccordion.ExpandedItemId
member.summary: ID of the single expanded item. If is true, this parameter is ignored, and you must use instead. When is true, the event callback will not be invoked. Do not use a constant value as it reverts the accordion to that item on every roundtrip. Use to set the initial state.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxAccordion.StayOpen
member.summary: Set to true to make accordion items stay open when another item is opened. The default is false, opening another item collapses the current item. When true, must be used to manage expanded items.

member.summary: ID of the item you want to expand at the very beginning (overwrites if set).

member.summary: IDs of the items you want to expand at the very beginning (overwrites if set).

member.name: T:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.Internal.ChipRemoveActionBuilder
member.summary:
ChipRemoveActionBuilder is responsible for generating an Action that resets a property referenced by a lambda expression to a specified value (typically default).
Unlike most expression-based tools, this builder defers all expression analysis to the point of action invocation. This enables fast action construction (suitable for per-render use) and evaluates constraints and assumptions only when the action is actually executed.

member.summary: CSS class that allows adding form-switch in derived .

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxCheckbox.NeedsInnerDiv
member.summary: For a naked checkbox without Label/LabelTemplate, we add form-check, form-check-inline to the parent div (allows combining with CssClass etc.). It is expected that there is just the parent div, input, and label for Text/TextTemplate. No label for Label/LabelTemplate, no HintTemplate, no validation message is expected. For a checkbox with Label, there is a parent div followed by a label for Label/LabelTemplate. Siblings label, input, label do not work well and there is nowhere to add form-check. Therefore, we wrap the input and label in the additional div.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxCheckbox.NeedsFormCheck
member.summary: For checkbox without any Text/TextTemplate we do not add form-check class.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxCheckbox.NeedsFormCheckOuter
member.summary: For checkbox without any Label/LabelTemplate and without Text/TextTemplate we do not add form-check to the parent div.

member.summary: Represents the collection of currently selected data items in the grid, primarily for data binding and state management in multi-selection scenarios.

member.summary: Event that fires when the collection of selected data items changes. This is particularly relevant in multi-selection scenarios. It is intended for data binding and state synchronization.

member.name: M:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.InvokeSelectedDataItemsChangedAsync(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{`0})
member.summary: Triggers the event. This method can be overridden in derived components to implement custom logic before or after the event is triggered.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.PreserveSelection
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current selection (either for single selection or for multiple selection) should be preserved during data operations, such as paging, sorting, filtering, or manual invocation of .
Default value is false (can be set by using HxGrid.Defaults).
member.remarks: This setting ensures that the selection remains intact during operations that refresh or modify the displayed data in the grid. Note that preserving the selection requires that the underlying data items can still be matched in the updated dataset (e.g., by item1.Equals(item2)).

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ContentNavigationMode
member.summary: The strategy for how data items are displayed and loaded into the grid. Supported modes include pagination, load more, and infinite scroll.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.PageSize
member.summary: The number of items to display per page. Applicable for grid modes such as pagination and load more. Set to 0 to disable paging.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ShowFooterWhenEmptyData
member.summary: Determines whether the grid footer is rendered when the grid's data source is empty. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.PagerSettings
member.summary: Pager settings.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.LoadMoreButtonSettings
member.summary: Configuration for the "Load more" button, including appearance and behavior settings. Relevant in grid modes that use a "Load more" button for data navigation.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.CurrentUserState
member.summary: Gets or sets the current state of the grid, including pagination and sorting information. This state can be used to restore the grid to a specific configuration or to synchronize it with external state management systems.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.CurrentUserStateChanged

member.summary: Delay in milliseconds before the progress indicator is displayed. The default value is 300 ms.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.TableContainerCssClass
member.summary: Custom CSS class for the div element that wraps the main table element. Excludes the which is not wrapped in this div element.

member.summary: Custom CSS class for the main table element of the grid. This class allows for styling and customization of the grid's appearance.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.TableHeaderCssClass
member.summary: Custom CSS class for the thead element of the grid. This class allows for styling and customization of the grid's appearance.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.HeaderRowCssClass
member.summary: Custom CSS class for the header tr element in the grid. Enables specific styling for the header row separate from the rest of the grid.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ItemRowCssClass
member.summary: Custom CSS class for the data tr elements in the grid. This class is applied to each row of data, providing a way to customize the styling of data rows.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ItemRowHeight
member.summary: Height of each item row, used in calculations for infinite scrolling (). The default value (41px) corresponds to the typical row height in the Bootstrap 5 default theme. The row height is not applied for other navigation modes, use CSS for that.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ItemRowCssClassSelector
member.summary: Function that defines a custom CSS class for each data tr element based on the item it represents. This allows for conditional styling of rows based on their data.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ItemKeySelector
member.summary:
Optionally defines a value for @key on each rendered row. Typically this should be used to specify a unique identifier, such as a primary key value, for each data item.
This allows the grid to preserve the association between row elements and data items based on their unique identifiers, even when the TGridItem instances are replaced by new copies (for example, after a new query against the underlying data store).
If not set, the @key will be the TItem instance itself.
member.remarks: Inspired by QuickGrid

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.FooterRowCssClass
member.summary: A custom CSS class for the footer tr element in the grid. This allows styling of the grid footer independently of other grid elements.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.PlaceholdersRowCount
member.summary: The number of placeholder rows to be rendered in the grid. Placeholders are used when loading data or when is not set. Set to 0 to disable placeholders. Default value is 5.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.OverscanCount
member.summary: Defines the number of additional items to be rendered before and after the visible region in an infinite scrolling scenario. This helps to reduce the frequency of rendering during scrolling, though higher values increase the number of elements present in the page. Default is 3.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.Responsive
member.summary: Determines if the grid should be scrollable horizontally across different breakpoints. When set to true, the table-responsive class is added to the table. Default is false.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.Hover
member.summary: Enables or disables the hover state on table rows within a <tbody>. When not set, the table is hoverable by default if selection is enabled. This property customizes the hover behavior of the grid rows.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.Striped
member.summary: Adds zebra-striping to any table row within the <tbody> for better readability. Rows will have alternating background colors. Default is false.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.SortAscendingIcon
member.summary: Icon to indicate the ascending sort direction in the column header. This icon is displayed when a column is sorted in ascending order.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.SortDescendingIcon
member.summary: Icon to indicate the descending sort direction in the column header. This icon is shown when a column is sorted in descending order.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.ItemRowAdditionalAttributesSelector
member.summary: Defines a function that returns additional attributes for a specific tr element based on the item it represents. This allows for custom behavior or event handling on a per-row basis.
member.remarks: If both and are specified, both dictionaries are combined into one. Note that there is no prevention of duplicate keys, which may result in a .

member.summary: Provides a dictionary of additional attributes to apply to all body tr elements in the grid. These attributes can be used to customize the appearance or behavior of rows.
member.remarks: If both and are specified, both dictionaries are combined into one. Note that there is no prevention of duplicate keys, which may result in a .

member.summary: Provides a dictionary of additional attributes to apply to the header tr element of the grid. This allows for custom styling or behavior of the header row.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxGrid`1.FooterRowAdditionalAttributes

member.name: T:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxListLayout`1
member.summary:
Provides a unified layout for data presentation components and associated filtering controls.
This component orchestrates the interaction between filter controls and the data presentation component. The data list is typically implemented using a component. Filters are displayed in a component, while filter values are shown as . Additionally, it supports predefined named views for quick switching between different filter configurations and other features such as a title, search box, and commands. Full documentation and demos: https://havit.blazor.eu/components/HxListLayout

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxListLayout`1.NamedViews
member.summary: Represents the collection of Named Views available for selection. Each Named View defines a pre-set filter configuration that can be applied to the data.
member.remarks: Named Views provide a convenient way for users to quickly apply commonly used filters to the data set. Ensure that each Named View in the collection has a unique name which accurately describes its filter criteria.

member.summary: Triggers the event. Allows interception of the event in derived components.

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxListLayout`1.TitleFromNamedView
member.summary: Indicates whether the name of the selected Named View () is automatically used as title. If true, the component's title changes to match the name of the currently selected Named View. Useful for dynamic title updates based on user selections from predefined views. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This update occurs upon the selection of a new Named View. It allows the Title to reflect the current data filtering context provided by the Named Views, enhancing user understanding of the active filter.

member.name: T:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.AnchorFragmentNavigationAutomationMode
member.summary: Automation mode for .

member.name: F:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.AnchorFragmentNavigationAutomationMode.Full
member.summary: Scrolls to the anchor on firstRender and whenever the location changes (). With , this mode is suitable only for static pages (where the size/offset of individual sections remains the same from the very beginning). Use or when the page contents load asynchronously and the layout changes.

member.name: F:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.AnchorFragmentNavigationAutomationMode.Manual
member.summary: Explicit calls to or are needed. Use this mode with when you need scrollspy to call to recalculate the target offsets before scrolling (scrollspy does not work properly on scrolled content).

member.name: F:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.AnchorFragmentNavigationAutomationMode.SamePage
member.summary: Same as , but scrolls to the anchor on if the page remains the same (just the #fragment portion changed). Works for most scenarios when you refresh the after data load and then you just need to navigate over the page.

member.name: T:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxAnchorFragmentNavigation
member.summary:
Temporarily (?) compensates for a Blazor deficiency in anchor fragments (scrolling to page#id URLs). Supports navigation with the component. GitHub Issue: Blazor 0.8.0: hash routing to named element #8393.
Full documentation and demos: https://havit.blazor.eu/components/HxAnchorFragmentNavigation

member.summary: The level of automation. The default is .

member.name: P:Havit.Blazor.Components.Web.Bootstrap.HxOffcanvas.OnHiding
member.summary: Fired immediately when the 'hide' instance method is called. To cancel hiding, set to true.
member.remarks: 1) This event should probably be named OnClosing to be consistent with other members, but "hide" is the Bootstrap event name and we should stick to it. We should consider renaming the other members in the future. 2) There is intentionally no virtual InvokeOnHidingAsync() method to override to avoid confusion. The hide.bs.offcanvas event is only subscribed to when the callback is set.
